dashboard.title: Dashboard

settings.passkey_error: Error registering passkey. Please try again.

education.title: Inclusive Banking Through Blockchain
education.subtitle: How blockchain technology is transforming banking access in developing economies
education.problem_p1: In developing economies, traditional banking systems often fail to serve the majority of the population. With 1.7 billion adults globally excluded from financial services, barriers to access create significant economic limitations.
education.problem_bullet1: Limited physical bank infrastructure with as few as 3 branches per 100,000 people
education.problem_bullet2: High corruption rates increasing costs and reducing trust
education.problem_bullet3: Unstable political environments disrupting financial services
education.problem_bullet4: Traditional systems requiring extensive documentation many citizens don't possess
education.stat1_description: of people in some developing regions lack access to banking services
education.solution_p1: Blockchain technology offers a revolutionary approach to banking by eliminating central points of failure, reducing corruption opportunities, and enabling secure financial transactions without traditional intermediaries.
education.solution_bullet1: Decentralized architecture eliminating single points of failure and reducing corruption vectors
education.solution_bullet2: Immutable transaction records preventing manipulation and fraud
education.solution_bullet3: Smart contracts automating compliance and reducing operational costs
education.solution_bullet4: Mobile-first access enabling banking services even in remote areas
education.blockchain_explanation: A blockchain is a chain of blocks, where each block contains transaction data and is cryptographically linked to the previous block. Below is a simplified visualization:
education.blockchain_block_description: Each block contains multiple verified transactions and a unique hash based on its contents.
education.blockchain_chain_description: Blocks are linked by including the previous block's hash, creating an unbreakable chain.
education.blockchain_security_description: Changing any transaction would alter the block's hash and break the chain, making tampering evident.
education.block1_explanation: Genesis block: The first block in the chain has no previous block to reference. It establishes the foundation of the blockchain.
education.block2_explanation: This block contains the hash of Block #1 (not shown here), linking them together. Changing Block #1 would invalidate this reference.
education.block3_explanation: As more blocks are added, the earlier blocks become increasingly secure. Each new block reinforces the validity of previous blocks.
education.app_p1: This application demonstrates how blockchain technology can provide secure, transparent, and accessible banking services to anyone with a mobile device.
education.app_p2: With a focus on simplicity, security, and cultural adaptation, our application makes financial services available to previously excluded populations.
education.feature1_description: Send and receive money with minimal fees and quick processing times
education.feature2_description: Store your funds securely with cryptographic protection
education.feature3_description: Complete transactions in minutes rather than days
education.feature4_description: Access your funds from anywhere with an internet connection
education.user1_story: A farmer in a remote area can receive payments for crops and access financial services without traveling long distances to a bank branch.
education.user2_story: A shop owner can accept secure digital payments, reducing cash handling risks and building a transaction history for future credit access.
education.user3_story: An older person with limited technical knowledge can easily manage their finances through a simplified interface with local language support.
education.user4_story: A public sector worker can receive salary payments directly and transparently, eliminating the risk of 'ghost worker' fraud.
